metadata.title: CVE-2022-32745 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in Samba. Samba AD users can cause the server to access uninitialized data with an LDAP add or modify the request, usually resulting in a segmentation fault.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32745` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
ldb-tools - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libldb2 - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
python3-ldb - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
python3-samba - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> combined patches are in bug 15096 Fixing this in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS would require substantial code backports. We will not be fixing this issue in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. In environments where this is of concern, we recommend updating to a more recent Ubuntu version.

criterions.comment: samba package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
